thread.title: Prank call triggers brief lockdown at Hmong International Academy in Mpls.
thread.title_full: Prank call triggers brief lockdown at Hmong International Academy in Mpls.

title: Prank call triggers brief lockdown at Hmong International Academy in Mpls.
text: Prank call triggers brief lockdown at Hmong International Academy in Mpls. January 9, 2017 — 4:18pm   Hmong International Academy was briefly locked down Monday as Minneapolis police officers searched the pre-Kindergarten- 8th grade school for signs of a gunman in what turned out to be a prank. The school was reopened after police and SWAT officers swept the building at 1501 N. 30th Avenue, and didn’t find a gunman. Police later determined that a group of students prank called 911 to report that there was a “person inside the school with a gun,” said police spokeswoman Sgt. Catherine Michal. “It was determined that it is a prank and the juveniles (involved) have been identified,” Michal said. It wasn’t immediately clear whether criminal charges will be pursued. LIBOR JANY
